item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, November 7, 2024 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. QNX is now free for anything non-commercial, plus there's an RPi image (59 points | 17 comments)
2. Using Ghidra and Python to Reverse Engineer Ecco the Dolphin (Dreamcast) (206 points | 54 comments)
3. AI for real-time fusion plasma behavior prediction and manipulation (133 points | 69 comments)
4. Mushroom Color Atlas (61 points | 10 comments)
5. Launch HN: Codebuff (YC F24) – CLI tool that writes code for you (29 points | 6 comments)
6. Show HN: BemiDB – Postgres read replica optimized for analytics (51 points | 23 comments)
7. Stop Analyzing Your Gut Feelings: A Counter-Intuitive Guide to Better Leadership (18 points | discuss)
8. Imaging shapes of atomic nuclei in high-energy nuclear collisions (9 points | discuss)
9. Edge Scripting: Build and run applications at the edge (11 points | 3 comments)
10. Passport Photos (1379 points | 195 comments)
11. Excerpts from John Wiegley and Adam Porter about personal information management (110 points | 43 comments)
12. I'm Not Mutable, I'm Partially Instantiated (110 points | 41 comments)
13. Masters of Horror and Magic: The German folklorists who helped build a nation (6 points | 1 comment)
14. Physics-informed Shadowgraph Network: End-to-end Density Field Reconstruction (9 points | 1 comment)
15. Ultraprecise method of aligning 3D semiconductor chips invented (85 points | 6 comments)
16. Even Microsoft Notepad is getting AI text editing now (185 points | 278 comments)
17. Linux Syscall Support (109 points | 67 comments)
18. Richard A. Cash, Who Saved Millions from Dehydration, Dies at 83 (93 points | 18 comments)
19. Optery (YC W22) Is Hiring Product Managers and Full Stack Developer (Node.js) ( | hide)
20. Hyperlight: Virtual machine-based security for functions at scale (15 points | 2 comments)
21. Automat (176 points | 66 comments)
22. Looking into the Nintendo Alarmo (98 points | 15 comments)
23. A blind but elusive critter that was presumed extinct is rediscovered (13 points | 4 comments)
24. A Font Book of Squiggles in Tristram Shandy (7 points | 1 comment)
25. URAvatar: Universal Relightable Gaussian Codec Avatars (82 points | 12 comments)
26. CodSpeed – integrated CI tool for performance testing (21 points | 2 comments)
27. Show HN: Hacker News frontpage as a print newspaper that you can personalize (510 points | 119 comments)
28. Gladiators in ancient Anatolia lived to entertain the masses (56 points | 33 comments)
29. Gardens reduce seasonal hunger gaps for farmland pollinators (8 points | discuss)
30. Evaluating the world model implicit in a generative model (133 points | 29 comments)
